articles.headline: Car Bankruptcy Cited as Option by White House
articles.snippet: A Bush administration official said a managed bankruptcy would be a last resort. The president is set to make a statement at 9 a.m. Eastern time.
articles.abstract: A Bush administration official said a managed bankruptcy would be a last resort. The president is set to make a statement at 9 a.m. Eastern time.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by David E. Sanger, Bill Vlasic and Micheline Maynard.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger, Bill Vlasic and Micheline Maynard

articles.headline: Banks Try New Ways to Handle Bonuses
articles.snippet: In a Wall Street bonus season unlike any other, banks are shrinking bonuses and using novel payments to deflect public hostility.
articles.abstract: In a Wall Street bonus season unlike any other, banks are shrinking bonuses and using novel payments to deflect public hostility.
articles.lead_paragraph: It may be the season to be wealthy  at least on Wall Street, where banks are awarding annual bonuses despite a growing outcry over pay.
articles.byline: By Louise Story and Eric Dash

articles.headline: A Year of Chaos in Finance
articles.snippet: Money benchmarks reached soaring heights and scraping lows in 2008, a year whose convulsions few saw coming.
articles.abstract: Money benchmarks reached soaring heights and scraping lows in 2008, a year whose convulsions few saw coming.
articles.lead_paragraph: Long-term interest rates are at their lowest level in half a century.

articles.headline: Prosecutors Accuse Ex-Lehman Broker of Passing Tips on Mergers
articles.snippet: The scheme, which earned $4.8 million in profit, depended upon tips from the employee’s wife.
articles.abstract: The scheme, which earned $4.8 million in profit, depended upon tips from the employee’s wife.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Where has my goose gone? Come back little goose.”
articles.byline: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: After 30 Years, Economic Perils on China’s Path
articles.snippet: Chinese leaders are facing a new era in which Deng Xiaoping’s export-led economic model faces challenges.
articles.abstract: Chinese leaders are facing a new era in which Deng Xiaoping’s export-led economic model faces challenges.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHENZHEN, China  The ruling Communist Party threw itself a big party on Thursday. The country’s leadership marked the 30th anniversary of the reform era that transformed China into a global economic power and, in doing so, changed the world.

articles.headline: Unlikely Player Pulled Into Madoff Swirl
articles.snippet: Some wonder if former S.E.C. official Eric Swanson’s marriage to Bernard L. Madoff’s niece slowed a federal investigation.
articles.abstract: Some wonder if former S.E.C. official Eric Swanson’s marriage to Bernard L. Madoff’s niece slowed a federal investigation.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eric Swanson received a startling call last Thursday from his wife, Shana D. Madoff, who said that something was terribly wrong. Officials from the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Justice Department had swooped down on the offices of Madoff Investment Securities, where Ms. Madoff was the compliance lawyer, seizing records and asking pointed questions as they began investigating one of the largest frauds in Wall Street history.

articles.headline: Even Winners May Lose With Madoff
articles.snippet: Those who profited unwittingly could be forced to give up some of their gains in an alleged multibillion-dollar fraud.
articles.abstract: Those who profited unwittingly could be forced to give up some of their gains in an alleged multibillion-dollar fraud.
articles.lead_paragraph: Amid the thousands of people caught up in the apparent multibillion-dollar fraud of Bernard L. Madoff, some investors stand out.

articles.headline: Redstone and Daughter Said to Clash on Debt Plan
articles.snippet: Sumner M. Redstone and his daughter, Shari E. Redstone, are feuding again, this time over Mr. Redstone’s efforts to renegotiate debt owed the Redstones’ movie theater company.
articles.abstract: Sumner M. Redstone and his daughter, Shari E. Redstone, are feuding again, this time over Mr. Redstone’s efforts to renegotiate debt owed the Redstones’ movie theater company.
articles.lead_paragraph: In October, when Sumner M. Redstone was forced to sell more than $200 million of stock in CBS and Viacom to satisfy the terms of a big bank loan, the media mogul and his daughter, Shari E. Redstone, with whom he has often feuded, presented a united front. Father and daughter were pushed together by the common interest of saving the family business from the banks.

articles.headline: Tax Break May Have Helped Cause Housing Bubble
articles.snippet: A 1997 change that ended the capital gains tax on home sales was a new incentive to plow money into real estate.
articles.abstract: A 1997 change that ended the capital gains tax on home sales was a new incentive to plow money into real estate.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Tonight, I propose a new tax cut for homeownership that says to every middle-income working family in this country, if you sell your home, you will not have to pay a capital gains tax on it ever  not ever.”
articles.byline: By Vikas Bajaj and David Leonhardt

articles.headline: Bush Aids Detroit, but Hard Choices Wait for Obama
articles.snippet: A $13.4 billion loan to General Motors and Chrysler may be followed by $4 billion more if the Obama administration finds sufficient progress.
articles.abstract: A $13.4 billion loan to General Motors and Chrysler may be followed by $4 billion more if the Obama administration finds sufficient progress.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article is by David E. Sanger, David M. Herszenhorn and Bill Vlasic.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger, David M. Herszenhorn and Bill Vlasic
